awd_abstract_narration: The Brooklyn Campus of Long Island University will initiate a six-              week, commuter Young Scholars project in Molecular Biology for 16               students entering grades 10-12.                                                                                                                                 The program will emphasize student participation in the basic                   techniques in molecular biology including isolation of DNA, DNA                 cloning, restriction enzyme analysis, Southern blotting,                        hybridization, expression screens, etc.  Experiments will be                    supplemented with lectures about the methodology employed, data                 analysis, and selected topics in molecular biology (i.e., structure             of macromolecules, gene regulation, etc.).  Participants will                   utilize the knowledge they have gained to perform an independent                research project during the final 2-3 weeks of the program.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
